messages.message: Unexpected any. Specify a different type.

suggestions.desc: Use `unknown` instead, this will force you to explicitly, and safely assert the type is correct.
Use `never` instead, this is useful when instantiating generic type parameters that you don't need to know the type of.

messages.message: Unsafe member access .modifiers on an `any` value.

Unnecessary escape character: \/.

suggestions.desc: Remove the `\`. This maintains the current functionality.
Replace the `\` with `\\` to include the actual backslash character.

messages.message: Invalid operand for a '+' operation. Operands must each be a number or string, allowing a string + any of: `any`, `boolean`, `null`, `RegExp`, `undefined`. Got `never`.
Unexpected nullable string value in conditional. Please handle the nullish/empty cases explicitly.

suggestions.desc: Change condition to check for null/undefined (`value != null`)
Explicitly treat nullish value the same as an empty string (`value ?? ""`)
Explicitly cast value to a boolean (`Boolean(value)`)

messages.message: Unexpected any value in conditional. An explicit comparison or type cast is required.

suggestions.desc: Explicitly cast value to a boolean (`Boolean(value)`)
